description:
Great coffee and amazing service! I got my typical almond milk latte and it was served just how I love it -- super fast, smooth, and with the perfect amount of foam. Many thanks to Ron, who took the effort to make conversation, putting a smile on my face and everyone else's. He even walked over to me to offer me the wifi password, seeing that I took out my laptop (outside!). Super considerate and super good vibes.

Beautiful environment with outdoor seating. Good place to go if you can work with the usual urban background noise, as it's right next to a lot of transit. Thanks Beanery and thanks Ron for a lovely afternoon!
author: Anna Z.

description:
Quick Summary:
- Recommend the Cafe Au Lait because one gets to personalize their coffee (you will see what I mean once you visit)
- Unique coffee ordering experience
- Cute decoration (the train caught my eye)
- The aroma of roasted coffee beans is spectacular
- We came at a right time, but a line grew while we were drinking coffee
- More of a grab and go coffee place because of limited seating space

We were lured into the cafe by the cute coffee bean roasting train near the cafe entrance. Since we were looking for a place to sit down and drink some coffee, we decided to try here. 

I was first surprised and confused at the four different coffee dispensers at the area, where there are sugar and creams, and I later realized why. I ordered the cafe au lait and when the received my order, it was a cup filled with foamy milk. I probably looked dumbfounded because the cashier gestured and told me to pour coffee from the coffee dispensers. 

There were four different types (one being decaf), and I selected the darkest roast. 

The coffee was SO GOOD! My favorite type of coffee is the taste where it has no sour and bitter notes. The french roast didn't include any of these, and after I took a sip, it left a lingering toasty aftertaste. Even my relative, who can't drink coffee because they don't like the bitter taste, was able to drink a share. 
I was even tempted to purchase a bag of coffee beans, but that will be for the next visit.
author: Mito I.

description: I've become a semi regular here. The coffee is good as the roast the beans on site an if you get the house coffee, $2.25-2.75, not crazy expensive.  Combine it with a pastry & you can sit & read the paper (some people still read news papers) for under $6.  (Credit cards - with Apple Pay - accepted above $5). Good WiFi, friendly staff and good coffee.  Works for me.
author: Leung T.

description: Super good and simple coffee shop! There's not as much seating in the morning, but after around 12pm there are more open tables. Good coffee, they have a lot of different roasts you can buy. The drinks also seem a little bit cheaper (cold brew was only $2.50). They have a ton of tea options too. Service is SUPER quick, i always get my drinks immediately. The space inside is a little cramped, the tables are kind of close to each other. The only downside is that there are no outlets to plug in anything, but there's free wifi! Sometimes people smoke right outside and the smoke kind of blows inside. But overall it's a very quiet and calm coffee shop! Really nice to get work done/ read at!
author: Patricia T.

description: Awesome coffee and bagel choices. Honestly one of the best coffees I've had. Location is great. And service is friendly and fast. Prices are also pretty good! :)
author: Cinthya G.

description: Big fan! This is a place filled with committed regulars - nice homey feel. They take their coffee seriously and you can taste the difference. Hard finding a table but grab and go is the way to go!
author: Megan C.

description:
Love the hipster vibe here. Service is fast, but seating is limited. They roast their own beans too, which is a plus.

The tables have coffee beans on top, covered by a layer of glass. Very nice!

Definitely worth a trip back to try out their other items.
author: Vicky Y.

description:
Their original French Roast coffee is great and fresh.
The staff is also friendly and kind!
author: Kurumi O.

description: Can't make a phone call while sitting there, having a coffee?  Ridiculous.  Too many socialists and "progressives" in this place.  Won't be coming back.  Silly PC.  Apparently having a phone call there violates people's "social contract", as one demo-socialist patron put it.
author: Saint P.

description: Happened upon this place by accident. Nice atmosphere but busy. Coffee is good. Service very good.
author: Kim M.

description:
I like this cafe a lot. Definitely has the hipster vibe like other reviews say. 

Impressions: the coffee has bold flavor and it was strong-- I felt jittery after. The location is small, so you will welcome sitting next to strangers. You will be lucky to get a seat as it was rather busy and lots of customers going in and out. The tables are all near outlets, so it's a nice place to get some work done. The tables have coffee beans inside. 

I left smelling like coffee but very satisfied. Can't wait to go again.
author: Jaime F.

description: a top of the line cafe with coffee drinks, food, ambiance and friendly personal customer service. a rare thing to have the person remember you even when you are a daily customer.
author: Renda D.

description: I just had a tea with some steamed soy milk. Great, yeah it's just tea. This review is for the sweetest girl/lady (long dark blonde ponytail fair skin I'm so sorry I didn't ask your name!) who was super friendly when I walked in. I was meeting a friend at the park, and I never come to this side of the city. My phone was dead and I needed to get to bart. I wanted to walk, and instead of being dismissive of the hour walk, she kindly gave me directions and also let me charge my phone. I can tell she really cares about her customers and is not one of those coffee shops who are only sweet to the regulars. Being someone in customer service, I always appreciate people like her. If I lived in the neighborhood I'm sure this would be my spot. Thanks again, and ps- I made it to bart and you're right it was a beautiful walk!
author: Juliana O.

description:
I used to love this cafe and went here for years. Quiet, good food, decent coffee and great wifi.
Well, the wife is now terrible and food prices have gone up by 50%. Sorry, but I'm not board with these changes. So long, Beanery.
author: Scott H.

description:
Finding a non chain coffee place is hard. Especially when your date doesn't like Starbucks.

Yeah, maybe we are off to a bad start already.

So I found this coffee joint through plain old walking up and down the street.

Has this old style feel which my date doesn't like. Either you want a chain place that's big or you get a small time roaster like the Beanery.

But, she wants it all.

Thankfully the coffee kept me busy. Refills are 85 cents, but with the way this date was going I didn't need need it, LOL.
author: Jack R.

description: They don't take cards if you're just buying a coffee drink for yourself.  The WiFi is also super unreliable. Pretty inconvenient.
author: Frank P.

description:
I like here. 
Price of sm house coffee is 2.00.
You can use your card over $5.
Already set the cup, and I can pour a cup of coffee by myself.
3 kinds of coffee are set. Strong-Medium-Decaffe.

Strong is so strong. Tong felt something like tingle. 
Medium is slightly sour taste.

I tried to pour 1/2 Strong + 1/2 Decaf.
The tingle becomes weak and I felt the rich taste.

There are 5 two-seater tables in the shop, and 3 tables outside.
No battery, each table is set within narrow space.

Wifi connection is good.

If you want to enjoy your alone time, good place.
author: Mitsuho S.

description:
Great coffee and service but limited seating inside. Nice, cozy atmosphere if you do find a spot. It's perfect for reading or getting some work done.

I really loved the neat tables they have. It's a layer of coffee beans with a glass tabletop. Really cute!
author: Linda X.

description: This is still a good time to meet a friend and have a chat. It is possible that the quality of the coffee has slipped just a bit. I missed the owner smoking his pipe in the doorway and hope he is alright, assuming he is still the owner.
author: Mr G.

description: good espresso coffees, cute place to sit and work. customer service is nice and genuine, and you could find some yummy bagels and some ok pastries to stay full while eating. Nothing taste extraordinary yummy, but the place is welcoming. 3 stars because of ok-quality food and good coffee + nice baristas. the only complain is that they were open both new years day (and new years eve) which is explanatory of bad management and mean owner (probably) and make one not want to support the business.
author: Helia S.

description: My husband and I buy the Organic House blend for our home coffee every week, and frequently stop in for some espresso drinks and bagels. The staff are always so lovely, we love living close by
author: A M.

description: Parking across the street (good luck, its tiny) but if you're in the hood, check this place out if anything else but for the double cappuccino. Wonderful. Totally SF. few tables. Super-close to UCSF so don't be surprised to see some unusual photos in textbooks on the table next to you! So SF!!!
author: Kevin F.

description: Great place to hang! Coffee roasting right in front of you, smells great. Staff is very friendly, and it's clean and comfortable. There is a parking lot across the street. Nice selection of teas, pastries and bagels, and oh yay, those chocolate chip cookies :)
author: M H.

description:
Loved this little place! Great drinks, great service, great ambiance!

PROS: fast, friendly, their mocha is perfect balance of sweet/bitter/coffee tastes
CONS: few small tables
author: Olivia F.

description: Had a good vibe walking in, I ordered the White Mocha. And let me tell you! It was phenomenal!!!! It was not too sweet plus you can still taste the richness of the espresso. Great place to stop by to grab a coffee, it has limited seating and it was jam packed on a Saturday morning, so probably not the best place to study. But, overall my experience at the Beanery was superb.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Super cozy and sweet place. Coffee is amazing. The hot chocolate is great too. Will come back some time.
author: Steph L.

description:
Cute cafe offering relaxed atmosphere and free wifi
They weren't roasting beans today but imagine the aroma can be amazing on those days
Value 3.5/5
Atmosphere 4.5/5 need better chairs all wooden
Service 4.5/5
Quality 4.5/5
17/20
author: Nina S.

description: The Beanery, located on 9th Avenue between Irving and Joudah, is simply the best coffee in the area.  The organic coffee and organic soy used to make my soy cappuccino was simply divine.  The foam was textbook- any Italian barista would be proud. The foam consisted only of tiny bubbles and was light, airy and lasted a good 15 minutes.  The coffee itself was dead on: roasted flavors not burnt, no acrid flavors, and became more favorable the more I drank.  Service was friendly.
author: Chad H.

description: Has an on site roaster which, if your there at the right time, you can watch coffee being roasted and smell the wonderful aroma. This place is a must for coffee lovers!
author: Adam H.

description: Fresh Coffee, tasty Latte, and friendly staff cozy & clean place perfect place to hangout Morning and afternoon.
author: Wafa R.

description: I don't like the coffee here. If you're only looking for coffee, try snowbird coffee.
author: Christina L.

description: Was having a bad day until I popped in here for a latte, and decided to try the open faced bagel sandwich. Delicious everything, and staff were genuine and friendly. Thanks for turning my day around!
author: Tammy M.

description: Friendly staff, great coffee and pastries. Unfortunately there is very limited seating because it's small. But great choice for something other than a Starbucks or Peet's for a change.
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
This placed turned me onto coffee!! 

I've never been much of a coffee drinker until I changed jobs and was required to come in at early hours. I needed coffee in my life. This place is right across the muni stops so it's perfect.

I usually get a small coffee and hit up their coffee corner. My favorite pick is the Organic French Roast or the Guatemalan Medium Roast whenever they have it! For those warm afternoons, a good pick me up is an Iced Chai Latte, hella goood. 

Service is always nice, theyre always very friendly in there. All in all, this is a great start to any morning!
author: Carmina D.

description: I'm not sure why people like this place so much. Is it because it's not-Starbucks? Is that enough of a reason to excuse the meh coffee, meh service, and tables that are too close to each other? Some coffeeshops have a comfortable and welcoming vibe. This one does not. Every time I go in here, it's like, people don't want me sitting next to them. And it seems I'm literally next to them because the tables are squeezed so close to each other. And the coffee is deep and dark, but not even mediocre Peet's quality.
author: Alecia K.

description: I'm very disappointed in the quality of the espresso when they do their own roasting. My cappuccino is undrinkable and I would have them remake it but I know it's a calibration that the machine is lacking so ordering another wouldn't solve the problem. I had high hopes Beanery.....
author: Jana L.

description: Its a small and cozy place at a very nice location. Friendly service as well. Love their latte as well as their currant scones.
author: Chul L.

description: The service is very quick and the iced lattes are delicious! They even were thoughtful and put a cardboard sleeve around my iced drink on a cold day so it wouldn't make my hands too cold. Overall a very good coffee shop and a great complement with the yummy Bakery goodies up the street!
author: N G.

description: Walked to this place with a friend to study. My friend got something right away, but I wasn't thirsty yet, so I sat down to study first since we were planning on being there for 3 hours. Eventually got an iced white mocha, which was decent. Kind of awkward that the owner came over to me to make a point that I didn't order anything and that the place was reserved for customers only. I'm with a friend...does it not count that she ordered something already?? Also, the place was completely empty other than us and 1 other person.  I understand if I'm hogging a table and the place is packed, but the fact that the place was pretty much empty made it even more awkward that she walked over to call me out. Don't know if I would come back, considering there's so many coffee places in the same area.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Really nice, small cafe for conversation or work. Gentle music and the overall environment is cozy. Lovely baristas, I think I may have fallen for his smile.

The coffee is great as well, haven't had such a smooth and delicately bitter cup in a long time, and I'm no amateur when it comes to cafe hopping.
author: Jenny L.

description: They easily make the best Lattes in all of the inner sunset! They also have amazing employees!
author: Diana A.

description:
The coffee here is good for your average neighborhood shop. Their drip is decent and their cappuccino is a (small) step above Starbucks. That said, the espresso is bitter and the milk aggressively foamy.

The Beanery ain't no Four Barrel, but when I'm waiting for the N Judah at 7am on a foggy SF morning, this place hits the spot.
author: Scott S.

description: Small but good. The inside seating is limited however the customer service and drink quality is amazing. The staff is kind, friendly and upbeat. Great place to grab a coffee as you're walking around the neighborhood.
author: Lynsey S.

description:
How did I put off writing a review for Beanery for so long? This is my favorite neighborhood place for coffee and I look forward to their iced caramel latte every time I'm at home. In a great little location on the corner of 9th and Irving in Inner Sunset, the Beanery is a cozy little coffee place that'll hit the spot every time without setting you back too much.

I always get their iced caramel latte, which comes with two shots and real caramel in a giant cup. All for less than $4. The baristas and servers are really friendly and know my order, big plus!

All in all, no frills, cozy, lovely, and Arizmendi is right next door for amazing pizza. Try some coffee before the farmer's market on Sunday across the street. And now they have free WiFi which is even better.
author: Kate M.

description:
they have sugar free almond syrup. 

only place in the city i've found with it. 'nuff said.
author: Celie H.

description:
I got their cappuccino two days in a row and I'm kinda digging this place. Charming old school roaster in the front, always people early in the morning even on the weekends totally not judging me for looking a hot mess. The staff cleaning up my friend's spill without a word and just making her a new drink as I go outside to wait in shame. They're pretty wonderful.

But they charge fitty cent for credit card unless you spend $5.
author: Vivian H.

description: I was craving coffee as I was getting my car fixed in the area. This place is a gem with deliciously smooth coffee. I had the Caramel Latte which was lightly flavored and did not overpower the espresso. They have a decent assortment of baked goods. Every table was occupied as I was walking through to order at the counter. The baristas were really nice and I waited a few minutes for my drink. Lively atmosphere for a small cafe.
author: Candace F.

description: Love my boys at The Beanery! The soy latte on ice (triple) is part of my daily routine -- literally -- and is the only reason I'm human before jumping on the N each morning. I rarely have to tell them my order, I just say yes when they ask if I want my usual  everything bagel with cream cheese is super delicious.
author: Neal B.

description: Delicious almond milk latte with flavor that took me back to my college Coffee House days! Quick weekday morning service.
author: Gabrielle O.

description: Everyone is super nice, the owner is very personable roasting coffee when I spoke to him. Good and coffee is good. Good place to read and chill.
author: James H.

description:
There was some time between brunch and an appointment so my lady friend and I headed over to Starbucks to get a hot cup of coffee and some work done.  Unfortunately, it was absolutely packed and there were no seats inside at all.  Instead, we decided to walk over to Beanery in hopes that there would be a place to sit indoors while enjoying a hot beverage.  They've got a few dog-friendly outdoor tables off the sidewalk but it was way too wet to sit outside.

The menu is kind of small and uninteresting so I ordered their special pumpkin latte.  The pumpkin flavors were pleasant and there was a lot of spice in it which reminded me of the holidays.  Is it actually pumpkin season right now?

While their pumpkin latte was decent, the service was a bit rude and they don't offer WiFi nor accept credit cards.  What's the point of a hanging out at a café on a rainy day if it doesn't offer internet access?  Beanery is just alright in my book but isn't a place I can see myself going to regularly for the lack of internet and other things.  I heard Good Earth has WiFi so if Starbucks is busy the next time I'm in the area, I'll be heading there instead.

Food: 7/10

Service: 4/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
I have been waiting to write a review of The Beanery for a while. Mostly because I couldn't formulate words to adequately describe how much I love this place. 

It is definitely my go-to in Sunset. The staff is so incredibly friendly and nice, the coffee is great and roasted in house in the morning (come by in the morning and the roaster happily explains the process), and I love the environment. People just seem happy here.  It's great. It's a small place, with only about 6 two-person tables and some seating outside, but I usually don't have a problem finding a spot to sit. I always leave with a smile on my face. 

Did I mention how awesome the staff is??? Seriously, go just to hang out with them.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Lousy coffee. Hard to believe they roast their own beans. Must not know what they are doing. Burnt taste. Beanery sucks beans.

Pastries are awful.

Nearby La Boulange is certainly much better and so is Starbucks (gasp).

Yes, Beanery is that bad.

Hopefully, all the recently-opened nearby competition will finally kill this place off.
author: Chuck G.

description: 5 stars for their latte and medium roast coffee. I've picked up ground beans of the dark French roast but it tasted a little too Burnt for me which is why I switched to the medium, brews perfectly. Lattes are smooth and get the job done (waking me up for those brutal Monday mornings), staff are great, I live up the block so this is my go to. Btw, their iced Americanos are great on a hot day!
author: Omar C.

description: I bought some of their "house blend" beans for my coffee machine (aeropress). Tastes great!
author: Tony G.

description:
I think I've just found my new favorite coffee joint.  Once you walk through those doors, that aromatic smell of fresh brewed coffee hits you right in the face, and you're swept away into coffee heaven.

I love coffee, but I love lattes even more.  The smooth and rich flavors are simply orgasmic.. I usually end up being extremely caffeinated because I finish them so fast.. and I want more!

I love the service.  Everyone is so friendly and the line moves quick.  It's a small space, but I'd love to grab a seat some time to just read or do some work.  Unfortunately, they do not have wi-fi.. so that's a slight bummer.  Still, it's a very cozy spot and I always make sure to drop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood.

I love you Beanery :)
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I ordered a small coffee and chose Costa Rica. The coffee is really good and the atmosphere is nice. I like the music and it's nice to sit by the window and watch the trains and people go by.

Came here with my friend Mariel before a hair cut, it was really nice.
author: Jeanine H.

description: Very friendly, cozy cafe with fair prices. Love coming here in the morning to get a warm drink before taking a walk through the neighborhood.
author: Jen W.

description:
We were on our way to grab some tea and coffee at Starbucks when we walked by the Beanery and saw a sign in their window urging them to support local businesses. Thank you for the reminder, Beanery! We veered in our tracks and ducked into this clean little cafe for some warm beverages on a cold afternoon. 

I've been on a tea kick so imagine my delight to see every kind of tea you could imagine. They also had these little things at the condiment bar that you put on your coffee cup under the normal plastic lid to protect yourself from splashing. Very smart!

Despite all of these plusses, I can't give more than three stars because I found the service to be quite surly and unfriendly. It was a slow time with no other customers to help yet the two guys looked and acted like we were bothering them by ordering drinks. If you want people to choose you over Starbucks or a similar monster chain coffee shop, you better up the customer service!
author: Christina P.

description: Great coffee! The baristas and staff are so nice and friendly. Good customer service is why I'm always coming back.
author: Joanne K.

description: Great medium roast coffee and delicious bagel!
author: Mandi R.

description: This my second favorite café because the coffee taste great and their French Pressed Coffee taste and feels so strong that I could buy seconds!!! Although I have trouble getting wifi even though the sign said "Free Wi-Fi." I still love it and right I go here every Saturday after my Taekwondo class/training just to go get coffee and relax.     :3
author: Jeremiah B.

description:
the Beanery has all kinds of dining options: salads, sammies, soups, bagels, dinners. etc. small place for dining in.

brew: orgainic guatamelean (m. 2)
-so smoooth and mellow. 
-4 brews to choose from.

drips:
-cash only
-only metered parking around.
-lots of tea options too.
author: Victor G.

description: Saw a scary line but decided to wait.  They handled the line very quickly.  5 stars for that.  4 for the drink.
author: Sean G.

description: I live nearby so I go here almost every day.  Great coffee, good people.
author: Nora F.

description: I am not a sit down and drink coffee type, I'm a got to run sorry love you still see you soon type. This shop seems like it's great for both. I picked up a medium decaf to start my afternoon and a brownie that has changed the brownie game. Love love love!
author: Angela F.

description: Wonderful coffee shop in the Inner Sunset!  Latte's flavorful, staff caring, thoughtful and fun. Definitely a local hangout... One of the best in the city.  Oh hell... The best in the city!
author: Bill V.

description:
Yes, better than Peet's and far above Starbucks, but in terms of hipster-quality freshly roasted, freshly ground beans - no. Not quite. Thus, a compromise: assuming that folks reading Yelp for a coffee shop already dislike the chains, I give it three stars in comparison to other local roasting coffee shops.

The outside tables are nice, especially on those rare sunny SF days. The macchiato is OK - espresso is too bitter, but I've been spoiled with my local coffeeshop, where espressos often taste like sunshine with a twist of lemon and a layer of chocolate (B2 in San Jose). 

Very quick service! Big plus. Competitively priced, also good. Looks like it draws local yokles, another good thing.
author: CK K.

description: Coffee was decent. I didn't try the espresso though. There were no outlets so make sure your computer is charged if you want to work.
author: Chris G.

description: Cute little hole in the wall coffee shop. The coffee is delicious, the prices are reasonable and the staff is charming. It was my first time here and I would gladly come again. (:
author: Sarah M.

description:
There has been a rather disturbing trend of coffee shops popping up serving lattes that taste like tea.  "But the light espresso you can taste it!"  No thanks.  I'll take too bold rather than too light any day of the week.  Also a bonus - you can get a different size!  No $4 for a 10 oz p.o.s. light espresso latte.  The Beanery is where it's at.  Sometimes the roast is too bold, but the majority of the time it just right.  Better than Peets.  Light to medium espresso drinkers should go somewhere else and discuss how ristretto shots and latte art are what make a good latte.  This place does latte art, but at least my cup isn't half foam in attempting to do it.  Other times it doesn't have latte art, and it's just a perfect cup.

The brownie is also amazing and could almost be labelled fudge.  Delicious
author: Adrian E.

description:
Wow!  Now this is coffee. I had the organic dark French roast. Definitely an eye opener. 
Small neighborhood place. 7 tables inside and a couple outside. Very friendly staff. Wifi available.
author: Howard C.

description:
Quick, easy, cheap. Great place to grab a good coffee and a simple breakfast.  They roast their own beans here, which puts them ahead automatically in my book.

Plus, they open at 6am (7am on Sundays), which is a huge plus for us East Coasters visiting and getting up 3 hours early.
author: Nathan H.

description: I love the beanery, and I like the one on 9th the best because there is more seating (although it can still be crowded at times). I love their French roast organic coffee and appreciate that they have soy and almond milk. The only things that would make it more fabulous would be if they got hummus and avocado as an option for bagels! Also It would be great if they got Califia Almond milk- which is so much better then the stuff in the box. These are my dreams...but overall the beanery is great.
author: Sky B.

description: Beanery is a great neighborhood coffee spot.  Nice folks and good coffee that they roast right there on 9th Ave.  A great alternative to the big chain across the street.
author: Dennis M.

description:
5 stars because it's hard to find the PERFECTLY balanced iced coffee. Caramel iced coffee, that is. 

That was all I ordered - I didn't add or subtract anything from how they originally make the drink - and I was soo impressed. Very rich espresso, just perfectly balanced with the right amount of sweetness and bitterness, no acidity in the way!

Oh might I add, the coffee shop also looks kind of vintage. Very cool and unique. Love it.
author: Jamie Y.

description: This neighborhood is filled with amazingly good coffee options. Loved their latte. It makes waiting for the Muni so much better!
author: Jeff B.

description:
good coffee. nice to sit around, look out the window and people watch.  next to arizmendi bakery so perfect!  go for a walk in golden gate park afterwards.
they have all the gadgets in the store making them seem like a pro at roasting coffee.
author: Linda T.

description:
Still one of my fave places to stop in for a cup of coffee.

I can grab one of the tiny tables and stack a pile of books to create a little cozy space for myself.  The barista here knows exactly how I like my breve lattes and it is served as thus, richly creamy and dark....the perfect caffeine for a lazy day.

Apparently, an old date from the past haunts these parts quite often, so it was a nice surprise to run into him.  Note to myself, stop dating in the Sunset.
author: Miika M.

description:
Recently revisited and still in love with this place if not completely head over heels!

As soon as I walked in, I smelled the sweet aroma of coffee and headed immediately to the counter. There was no line, but the place was filled with their morning regulars sitting at each and every table, but one (for me!) I don't usually have time before work to have a sit down breakfast, but I had a little over a half hour to take my time so I did.

At the counter, I was kindly greeted by an older man who smiled and took my order. I ordered just an iced coffee, and as soon as the words left my mouth, a younger guy went right to making my order. I'm used to the person taking my order asking if I have any personal preferences but this time, the younger man making my order waited for a pause in the transaction and sweetly asked if I wanted room for cream. I liked this; it felt as if I had their entire undivided attention. It was nice compared to other establishments like Starbucks and some cafés where I attend school. 

Any-who, the rest of the transaction went smoothly and my drink was ready before I even finished paying, but I didn't feel rushed to move out of the way for the next guest. They welcome friendly small talk.

Aside from the great staff, the Beanery is really great because they have this awesome looking machine where I'm guessing they grind their beans in house!

They do have a bathroom but I haven't seen it. 

Cash only!
author: Sheena W.

description: Nice staff but the espresso was not that great, but it is conveniently close to golden gate park.
author: Tatiana S.

description:
When I walk into the Beanery, I get a huge sense of nostalgia.  I love how there is a big roaster in the front and the tables are set up by the bench on the side.  It provides for an atmosphere to either enjoy your cup of coffee by your self or to have a good conversation with the person next to you.  Having no wi-fi also encourages more human interaction or reading books.  The coffee is pretty strong as well.   

What I really liked was the attentiveness of the staff when I was buying coffee beans; the guy took his time to work with me to help me understand the different flavors of the coffee beans.
author: Mel L.

description:
What is the big deal about Blue Bottle when we have better coffee right here in the Sunset? As a previous coffee buyer, I know my beans. Their Kenyan is better than anything, anywhere. At a very reasonable price.

Good people, good management, excellent coffee (beans and bevs) - that's what you get when you're focused on service rather than trying to garner hipsters into creating a buzz. There may not be a lot of trendy stories about the Beanery, but that only means they're too busy making beautifully roasted beans. 

Us locals prefer to enjoy our hidden gems without the annoying questions of slow-moving tourists who wouldn't know good coffee from generic, anyway.
author: Jill B.

description: Love this neighborhood spot. Cozy friendly and yummy coffee. Good espresso that's a breath of fresh air compared to starbucks. Also they do soy drinks well!
author: Stefanie G.

description:
I like this better than the Beanery on Irving.  Staff are SUPER friendly and funny.  They seem to have a following--regular customers constantly coming in and joking with the staff in Spanish.  Gave it a nice inclusive vibe.

But it's too crowded for my liking, seating is all smushed together so you'll definitely get to know your neighbors (This can be a good or a bad thing) 

Coffee is just fine but nothing special and pastries looked good though I didn't partake.
author: Meg M.

description:
Yum! This place has some delicious coffee and great atmosphere. The only downside is that they are CASH ONLY so be aware of this when you order a double grande soy latte and an iced triple shot soy latte :)

The baristas are great and I love how they have a roaster in the front and roast coffee in house right there in front of you. It's a great experience knowing that the coffee shop understands coffee, roasts their own and really gets in touch with the beverages that they are serving. They also have a huge variety of different types of coffee and great lids I must say (their lids are raised so it doesn't touch the foam on your latte ... who woulda thought!).

Their coffee is no more or less expensive than most other places in SF. Great stop!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Stopped in here for a cappuccino, which was most excellent. There wasn't a heart or design in my foam, but the foamed milk was extremely thick and rich. Much thicker than from other cafes. They have a fully-operating coffee bean roasting machine right on display in the front of the cafe. This is fun to look at, and no doubt functional, but it takes up over half of the cafe, which was small to begin with. Hence there was no available seating. Granted, the coffee is excellent, which is why it was full. Yet, I would've liked a place to sit and enjoy it. Loses one star for that. Otherwise great.
author: Brian C.

description:
Our coffees were very good and we had a couple of pastries which we were quite happy with. 

It took a couple minutes of camping to get a table, though. Nice bonus is that you can see the muni stop across the way and relax until you see the train pulling up.

Raspberry almond bar FTW.
author: Jack S.

description: Came in here to try their coffee because their coffee at the beanery on Irving was pretty good. There was a customer ahead of me but I was quickly assisted by another person so I didn't have to wait. I got a decaf soy latte and it was made in about 5 mins or less. Staff was friendly but the latte was not so good. Not sure if it was because I got soy.. I think i also tasted some other stuff in the latte like espresso grinds? in there which was not very pleasant. I think I prefer the beanery on Irving instead.
author: Carmen L.

description: Loved this little coffee shop in sunset! They even have a old fashion coffee machine there!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Excellent service. Reasonable prices for fair trade and organic coffee. They roast in-house which is a plus!
author: Morgan H.

description:
Star # 1 - Price; $1.65 for small house coffee aint bad by my standards. And for good house options, I consider it a deal.

Star # 2 - Location; Right there at 9th and Irving makes for a very convenient location. Don't be tempted by Starbucks. Just don't. Go here. Enjoy.

Star # 3 - Ambiance; Don't even know what that giant roaster is at the front but it looks friggin sweet and definitely creates this atmosphere of being in an authentic coffee house. If you're lucky to be around when the beans are spinning you're in for a treat cause the smell is a nasal-orgy. This is also a cool spot to meet a friend, have your coffee in-house, do a little emailing, or just to read a book and relax. 

Star # 4 - Friendliness; I just moved in to the neighborhood and felt welcomed right off the bat.  Fast forward a few more visits and it only gets better.  These are some cool people who work there and you can tell they enjoy their jobs (at least compared to most other people). And any time you see people working and enjoying at the same time you got to take that as a sign of a well-run place. 

Star # 5- Coffee; what really matters.  I stick to the house options but it is always good fresh stuff.  And as a bonus, their coffee bar is stocked.  They have the only honey jars I've ever seen someone use without making a mess, coffee screens that go under your lid to prevent spills (they work so well), long spoons for mixing, and a few spices among other things.  The bar could be a little bigger, but as long as you're not impatient it's cool.  You can definitely tell they went the extra mile in this department.
author: L M.

description:
I have seen this coffee/tea shop since I was a kid, but I have never actually been here... then again, I'm not really a coffee person, so I wouldn't exactly go and seek out places like this.

However. I will have to say, they make an amazing mocha. Okay... so maybe I'm not the best judge of this (didn't seem like there was much coffee in it... or the flavor was just really well developed/blended, but I do like it that way) and it was crazy creamy and thick. There was tons of chocolate flavor and it was so perfect way to end a bike ride on a freezing day. Seating can be a little hard to come by (it's a tiny place), though there are a couple seats outside as well. 

This place is at a busy intersection (great for people watching) and is conveniently located right next to a bus stop. Wouldn't mind coming back for sure!
author: Denise C.

description:
One of the best coffee shops in the city and the prices are unbelievably low!! 
All the people here are fucking awesome!!
author: John R.

description: It's my to-go neighborhood coffee spot. I am a big fan of their Java roast: super size 20oz is only $2,25! The guys behind the counter are always nice.
author: Katie K.

description: The people here are always so nice to me. They know me as soon as I walk in and always make my morning even better. The coffee served here is amazing. I love this place. The prices here are very inexpensive. Credit cards are accepted but there is a $5.00 minimum.
author: Diego L.

description: Best coffee in the neighborhood.  The scones are good too. It's a tight squeeze to the register- not stroller friendly.
author: Rocio G.

description:
I love supporting neighborhood coffee shops. 

The other day, I was roaming around Irving Street and looking for an alternative to Starbucks, which is always packed and often, lacks that "cozy" feel. Beanery, on 9th & Irving, fit the criteria. Cozy and small, it had the vibe I was looking for. 

However, there are a few things to note before deciding to come to the Beanery on 9th & Irving. Unfortunately, the Beanery doesn't offer WiFi to its patrons. It also accepts cash only. WiFi tends to be pretty standard in most coffee shops these days, so I was honestly quite surprised that it did not offer it. Additionally, there were no wall outlets for me to plug my laptop in (at least I couldn't find any). These are some setbacks that the management of Beanery may want to consider in future improvements. 

The cashier did tell me that their location on 7th & Irving does provide WiFi, so that's good to know for the next time I want to go to a coffee shop on Irving. 

Would I come back? Probably, if it was just to purchase coffee and a pastry to go, or if I was meeting with a friend to chat.
author: Mari S.

description: Honestly- this place has the BEST BARISTAS in The City.  They make killer lattes and are always super friendly without being "too much".  Love the people that grind the beans here.  The coffee is DELISH.  Always a safe choice whether it be coffee in hand or some beans to take home for later.  Their loose leaf teas are also very good and inexpensive.
author: Gregarious B.

description:
Caffeine machine.

Smooth coffee. A ridiculously efficient cashier and barista combo churning out drinks in less than a minute. Vintage coffee machines as decor. Beans built into the tabletop.

No WiFi and that's fine. Less things to distract you from a very good experience.
author: Jason B.

description:
One of the best cafe's in the city! Not only do they give you a quality drink... but the prices make you coming back for more! And I will be. 

Seating is, yes, a hassle. But, hey, I'm not complaining. I'll just get my drink and stroll the streets or walk across the street to the Farmer's Market. :)
author: Jane E.

description:
This is my new favorite coffee shop since moving to the inner sunset. The Beanery is a classic coffee shop, unlike many of SF's artisan coffee shops. While I like artisan drip coffee as much as anyone, I prefer the Beanery's small town coffee feel. When you order a cup of joe they hand you a cup to fill yourself from a selection light, dark, and swiss water decaf coffees. They roast their own beans, so you know its good quality. I've ordered the mocha couple times, which was quite tasty. 

The prices are great: $1.50 for a 12 oz coffee, lattes for less than other shops in the area. 

The dark brown interior is nicely decorated and there is a coffee roaster to the right of the door. I mostly order coffee to go, so I can't comment on the tables, but there are usually at least  a few people sitting and enjoying a drink.
author: Grush K.

description:
On my weekend of cafe stings, in an effort to finish this Steve Jobs book, I took a Monday afternoon to chill at Beanery.  I was originally going to read in the park outside Academy of Sciences, but caffeine called for me, so took a ride over to this spot.  There's something about this street and intersection that I like.  It's not busy like downtown, but its busy enough where you see a good flow of people, students from UCSF, tourists coming from the park, locals strolling and picking up their afternoon Arizmendi's, other distant locals coming to the restaurants, the Muni train make its crazy turn at the corner.... its just a nice spot to look out and watch the interaction of everything here.  

I had a triple shot macchiato.....it was good.  Espresso was strong and the milk was perfectly frothy to accompany it.  It got me through perhaps a 6th of the book.....good enough for me.  I took a seat outside even though it was getting somewhat chilli and I was able to enjoy the scene as well as my book.  

Only thing about this place is its probably too small, and although I like that display of machinery, it doesn't get appreciated enough just by sitting there.  Something is just not complete with this place, but for the most part, I like it.
author: Vincent K.

description:
I was driving through Sunset, and it was time for a fix. Since I prefer to avoid Starbucks when I can, and I do like to patronize local businesses - I went on Yelp and found Beanery.

Very impressive industrial coffee grinder, clean, attentive staff, 3 different kinds of coffee to offer, clean station with all the accessories for sugar, half-n-half and the rest - just perfect. Roasters blend turned out to be a great choice - tasty, strong, good caffeine kick.

The cherry on top was a cool novelty - splash guard for your coffee! It is a round plastic net that you put on your cup before you close it with a lid. It prevents coffee from jumping up and onto your freshly pressed shirt while you weave through traffic. It worked!
author: Mico S.

description:
I had a blend of organic French and whatever the fair trade blend was.  I can't get bogged down with the details.  It was definitely worth it.  The only thing I could have done without was the really loud conspiracy theorist sitting 2 tables down from me.  I could not drown out those mutterings no matter how loud I turned up my podcast.  Most days I would be amused but I hadn't eaten by that point.

The setting is beautiful with a large coffee roaster as part of the scenery.  I recommend going down the street to Arizmendi, grab a coffee from Beanery, and then head over to the botanical gardens and hang out with the turtles.
author: Ashley I.

description:
I probably wouldn't have written this post, except for the fact that one of the men behind the counter actually asked me not to. I wanted to try to Beanery as an alternative to Starbucks across the street. I walked in and immediately the 3 men behind the counter started whispering and snickering. I asked for a small coffee and the man behind the register then I asked if I was single. I'll spare you my rant about why exactly this is inappropriate and just assure you that I do not appreciate being asked about my relationship status as the FIRST THING SOMEONE SAYS TO ME. Particularly and especially when I HAVE to engage with someone because they are offering me a service. After I said that I wasn't single, one of the other men made sounds of sympathy and another giggled, and the man who asked said that at least he tried...Then one of the other men asked me if I thought the man who asked about my status has beautiful eyes. Clearly uncomfortable, I fumbled with my wallet for a moment and didn't answer. It was then that one of the men asked me not to Yelp about this. Another was like welp, I guess we're losing another customer.... 
I planned to stay and do work, but decided to leave, give my coffee to the delightful homeless man on the corner and go to Starbucks. 
What I wish I would have said? "Your question is wildly inappropriate. I am not here simply for your viewing and/or dating pleasure and I don't appreciate abrupt advances of romantic or sexual nature. I'd like to speak to a manager." Unfortunately I hadn't had any coffee yet and was so stunned by the blatant sexism that I didn't manage to say everything I wanted to. Hopefully a manager sees this, is able to identify who was working at 11:30-12pm on Thursday, December 17th and have a stern talking to them about how to treat customers, women, and HUMAN BEINGS IN GENERAL. Too bad, Beanery. Might be better if you renamed your chop Patriarchy in a Cup.
author: Sage R.

description: Don't spend too much time at the beanery. Bought a few cups of coffee and I occasionally go there to pick up a bag of fresh grounds. Pretty standard coffee joint. Usually a bustling atmostphere. Not too much sitting room so you might be out of luck if you go there to get work done. Acceptably friendly staff. Great location.
author: MichaeL S.

description:
My go-to spot for good, no frills coffee.

At $1.50 for a 12 fl oz cup of aromatic heaven, Beanery's got me beat. Yeah, yeah... I'm a Starbucks hater. Flash roasting's not my kinda thing; it tastes like burnt crap! On the contrary, Beanery's brews all end on a smooth, mellow note. No bitter aftertaste AT ALL! Yeah. Starbucks  and Peet's try to brainwash us into believing that bitter is better. 

Their Sumatra is the bomb. All the other roasts are pretty good. They've got a few organic roasts too, so that's a plus! 

Cute tables filled with coffee beans, but really limited seating. Better for the dash-in-dash-out'ers.

Oh, and $1 danishes, muffins, scones, and other pastries at the end of the day! NICE.
author: Colleen W.

description: One of the nice coffeeshops in Saratoga. Small place with good mocha!
author: Sam L.

description:
This is my go-to coffee place after my work out. I love good quality coffee; their coffee is organic, costs less and tastes awesome so there's no need to go to Starbucks from across the corner (FYI, if you haven't noticed Starbucks's coffee is over roasted and bitter). Plus they have two locations within a three block radius so go to whichever is "closer" to you.

The staff is usually nice; the guy who always takes my order remembers my drink even after weeks of not going in.
author: Theresa M.

description:
No, they don't offer wifi and outlets, and that's what i like. The coffee is good, the staff is friendly, and it's a really unassuming place. I feel like i've gone back to a time called 1998, when people sat around coffee shops with these things made out of trees called books, and humans interacted verbally with other humans.

The Beanery won me over as a loyal customer the first time i came here. I was having a bad morning and all i wanted was a cup of coffee. Stupidly, i left the apartment with only $1 in cash. I stopped at Arizmendi first because i like their coffee and thought i could get a pastry too, while i was there. That's when i discovered my faux pas.

So i walked down to the Beanery and frowned at the fact they are also cash only. I didn't really feel like going to an ATM to pay more in transaction fees than a cup of coffee was worth, and i said that to the barista too. She asked how much i had, and i said i had my measly dollar. She handed me a cup and said, "Just get us next time. We all need coffee sometimes, right?" Bless her heart. I haven't seen her since that fateful day, but i always tip large when i go back, in the hopes that she'll get back what i owed.
author: Phuong M.

description: I went here in the middle of the day after walking around the city with a date (brown chicken brown cow!)  The coffee was sooo fragrant, the flavors soo bold and delicious!  I got the caramel latte, my companion got an Americano.  It was definitely something to remember.  If I'm ever around here again, I'll definitely be hitting this place up again!  It's also  a great place to sit and people watch if you do manage to snag one of the seats outside.
author: Ann L.

description: Reasonably priced coffee offered here. I enjoyed an iced cappuccino. It was tasty and the atmosphere was very chill. Looks like they roast their beans in house so you know they care. I would rate this place above average for SF.
author: Jacob K.

description:
Just moved into the inner sunset area and needed my local 7am fix. They do not let me down. Let me tell YOU why!

There coffee doesn't taste generic or stale or processed. It just tastes damn good! Like it should. I'm not a drip coffee guy I like my espresso. I need my caffeine early to even function. Its tasty, never burned. Just right! and ZING! I'm ready to go!

The fellas who usually hold down the AM shift are quick! After a few visits they knew my order. The speed is very important for me in the morning. I never waited more then 3 or 4 minutes for my espresso. WAY faster then the chain near by. Or any chain for that matter. They rock that am shift better then most places I have gone.

The ladies who hold it down in the afternoon and evening are a treat! They are funny, raw, "tell you how it is" people. The world needs more of that. I almost feel as thought they are like many bartenders I know and like. Strong opinions, like it or not attitude about life, not their service. They care about the coffee they make and have re-made mine when it didn't come out to their liking. I was cool with it, they weren't. There is also a few more people who staff the afternoons who are just as fabulous! Easy to talk to and make great drinks!

They get complaints on the norm about no wifi and no pedicure service. They are happy to remind you, this is a coffee shop, not a hang out and study for the day shop. Buy coffee sit if you want, but then go. No plush seats or free wifi. Simple coffee service. I feel for them as I get ridiculous requests all the time. 

But they are super nice. great hospitality. Always smiling even on bad days. leave you with a smile and a light laugh. I enjoy getting a latte or mocha at the end of my work day to carry me through the night to be productive rather then pass out exhausted. They are open til 7 and that makes this caffeine junkie happy.

For a no thrills, great tasting, local coffee joint come here. They make good coffee and get you on your way. What else do you want? Oh more? go to the chains then. This place isn't for you. Besides the last thing I want when enjoying my coffee is to watch you play farmville, facebook and hear your annoying music from your over played ipod headphones. 

There are many places, but a block or so away, that charge DOUBLE what they charge. Ridiculous!
author: Benjamin W.

description:
We stopped in today to get what The Beanery's fans purport to be fantastic coffee and find a place to sit and get some work done. The beautiful Sunday weather reinforced our good moods, and we were all smiles as we entered. However, when my friend cheerfully inquired at the counter about outlets for our laptops, the girl behind the counter killed the mood and actually sneered "um, no, we're not *that* kind of place." Understandably, many businesses will subtly discourage workforce and student camping at their establishments by simply not providing outlets or wifi, but never in my life has anyone outwardly attempted to make me feel less-than for being one of *those* people until now.

Dear Beanery Barista,

A simple "sorry guys, no outlets!" would have sufficed, but your rude, dismissive commentary was extra special. It's not often I have my parade shat upon by a stranger, but you nailed it. I left feeling rejected and angry, and ultimately undeserving of good customer service. 

The only plus side of this experience was a big one: The discovery of the bright, sunny, and EXTREMELY CHEERY Dash Cafe around the corner. They proudly and CHEERFULLY serve Blue Bottle coffee, and the service, environment, and camp-out-ability are impeccable. I recommend this place to anyone and everyone, and will absolutely come here again.

The Beanery, however, can suck it.
author: bex m.

description:
Small roaster-retailer.  The coffee selections are not estate lots....seems to be promoted by country (i.e. Guatemala is offered, not Finca Vista Hermosa from Huehuetenango, Guatemala).  The coffee is okay, but not great.  The pastry selection is thin.  The staff is friendly, but not super knowledgeable about coffee.  I go here because it's a neighborhood place, but if you're looking for 3rd/4th wave coffee, you'll be disappointed.

I think Dash around the corner has better coffee and is a bit more cozy.

For what it's worth, I own a roasting company and a few cafes in Oregon.  The Beanery is not a competitor, but a peer, so I hate to say anything critical.  At the same time though, I didn't think my role as a coffee roaster should preclude me from offering my thoughts on Yelp.
author: Allen T.

description: Fast, clean, fresh, reasonably priced, and convenient. Not too shabby at all. Had to postpone my beloved Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf in Downtown as I was gonna fall asleep in Irving post the De Young Museum, and Park Gyros.
author: R C.

description: I come to this place all the time and I think the coffee is great and the customer service is equally awesome!  Nice place in Inner Sunset to catchup with friends over coffee or get some work done with their free wifi.  Fun fact: their tables are actually made of coffee beans!!! ;)
author: Ubz D.

description: Was looking for a coffee shop nearby and this place happened to be the closest. The place is pretty small but it wasn't cramped. The service was quick and the latte was great. I'll definitely come back.
author: Thanh T.

description: Oh, the little coffee place that could! It just warms my spirits soooo much to see a place like this one. I travel five days a week to the Inner Sunset from the Mission, and as soon as I step off the train, I breathe a sigh of relief and my heart just sings - it's like going back 20 years to the San Francisco I once loved so well - a neighborhood full of wonderful, unique, affordable mom-and-pop businesses! This coffee spot is definitely one of those - it has quickly become a favorite habit. There's absolutely nothing that the expensive, trendy Mission coffee places have that this place doesn't have (yes, they even roast their own beans). The biggest difference is, Beanery doesn't have a need to make a big production about what they do - they just do it humbly and simply without any Internet infomercials - they roast their beans and they do it well but they don't need to tweet about it, post it to the latest site or what-have-you. Their focus is on real life - knowing all their customers by name, saying hello to the neighborhood folk. The coffee is delicious too, by the way - and they have a wonderful assortment of treats, even healthy ones, to go along with it. When you're done with your coffee, you should wander half a block down the street to some of the other treasured destinations the Inner Sunset has to offer - Le Video, Green Apple Books - and one of the last 'professional' magic shops left in the world. I'm having a ball in this charming neighborhood and it's because it puts people first, not fame and profit. Thank you, Beanery, for being so kind.
author: Heidi-Jane S.

description: Love the Beanery! Loyal customer and fan of the employees. Great for any drink and yummy pastries.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Fast and friendly staff. I've been in there enough for one or two of the workers to recognize me.

Since I find myself getting my coffee fix here, what I like to say how strong and delicious the daily variety of brewed coffees and as well as my soy lattes. Sometimes I feel like having a cup of hot tea. In that case, there are many varieties of tea bags to choose from. Pastries and bagels are definitely fresh and super yummy from Semifreddi's and House of Bagels.They either sell them at a discounted price ($1/pastry) towards the end of the day or give them out to homeless (that was what I was told).

What I am always amaze is how they manage to remember the drinks the customers order especially when there are 3 to 4 cups lined up to be filled. Either way, they've only messed up my drinks about twice since I did not clarify whether I wanted a mocha or a latte. But so far, no mistakes! Just recently as a suggestion from a previous yelper, I decided to try a caramel soy latte and let me tell you this: 

"OMG...so smooth with the right amount of caramel. Why does Starbucks' taste like fake sugar and crap" (By the way, I do not dislike SB for some things)

Anyway, small coffee shop with a neighborhood feel. Sitting is quite limited although the park is about 2 blocks away. Also, CASH only...just like most small businesses in this neighborhood.
author: Kim L.

description:
Positives: Outdoor seating, Coffee (of course)

Love this local coffee joint!! 

Greeted by the functional roaster when you first walk in, I love this neighborhood roast/coffee house. Always wonderful for a delicious pick-me-up, I feel lucky to have this so close. =)
author: Sue Y.

description:
Beanery is my local coffee shop. I live and work in the neighborhood, so I am often there twice a day. In my opinion, the best coffee is the Roaster's Blend.  Both their local shops, the one on 9th Ave and the one on Irving at 7th Ave, have great staff too. 

Martin, Alex, Heather, Cruz, etc. everyone is very friendly and helpful...
author: Shelley D.

description: Alright latte but don't expect to find seating ever! People love sticking around for hours. Definitely more of a grab and go spot. Very convenient location and great for people watching.
author: Tessa R.

description: The aroma of this coffee shop is amazing. I ordered a small latte, the barista made it really quickly (almost too quickly), which surprised me a little bit. The coffee was alright, not the best I've ever had. The expresso was really strong, I was pretty jittery afterwards hah
author: Elaine N.

description:
The place to be in the Inner Sunset.

Right next to the long carb fiend-ing line outside Arizmendis, Beanery is where you'll find the Inner Sunset locals.

There are babies, young parents, hippies, professionals, grandmothers, grandfathers, - and everybody in between sipping on their beanery brew, watching the Inner Sunset come alive - each day.

The interior is dark, but warm - and smells like fresh made coffee. Early in the morning, if you can grab a seat - sit tight.

Though I've yet to try the coffee here, I love popping in for an iced chai - on the weekend. An always perfect propellant for a walk to the park.
author: Jessica T.

description: My harrar coffee tasted great and the vibe to the whole place is really laid back. I talked to a guy for like 30 min who apparently was the dude who invented and legalized the microbrewery/restaurant combination in like 1979. Wild times in inner sunset.
author: Misha T.
John M.

description:
Fresh roasted beans well priced. 
*1 star for promoting a small local business
**1 star for quality
***1 star for good value
****1 star for offering a free lb of beans w/purchase of 10 lbs
***minus 1 star for owner attitude regarding offer of the free pound-much eyerolling and sighing when you cash your chips in. Don't do it if it puts your knickers in a twist....

note: CASH ONLY
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Just because it's not Starbucks and just because it's a local coffee joint in a hip place like the Inner Sunset, doesn't mean it necessarily serves good coffee.

I had the French Roast black (just like my soul) and it tasted burnt (just like my heart).  There wasn't a sour aftertaste like there usually is with Starbuck's Pike, but there really isn't anything special about this place.  I'm sure their lattes are better because milk and sugar have a tendency to make everything better, but at least at Starbucks, you'll get your drink in a cheery holiday cup.  

Maybe I'll try another blend and/or the other location, but seriously, the Inner Sunset is in need of some Peet's.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I like this coffee shop. They have great coffee, nice looking pastries (I didn't try any yet), and it's a nice atmosphere. I had a hot chocolate and it was delicious. The service was super friendly. I bet the tables get taken up quickly on a weekend, but I went on a weekday night and had no trouble grabbing a table. The wi-fi signal was strong. They sell end-of-the-day pastries for $1. All good things!
author: Halley S.

description:
Iced Coffee. It was alright, more nutty than bold. I prefer my coffee bolder and richer. 

Service was great though! The baristas were super nice, I actually didn't have enough cash for it and they only took cash. They were nice enough to let me off sans a dime. Very kind of them, +1 star for that.
author: Constance C.

description: The organic Espresso Blend beans are fantastic. I'm pretty picky about the espresso coffee in my cappuccino that I make at home, and the Beanery's blend is great.
author: Joe S.

description:
****Drip Coffee Only Review***

After another pig out session at Pasquale's and a little pit stop at a few stores, I couldn't resist the temptation of a cup of Joe when my nostrils were struck with the scent from the coffee gods.

I just dropped in really quick (the place is tiny), ordered a small cup of coffee which you serve yourself. I had my traditional Peet's blend which is a Mocha Java and French Roast combo. The coffee was satisfying and smooth. No bitter aftertaste and tasted really darn fresh for self-serve.

The coffee here is organic if that is your thing.  I liked it and should the coffee urge strike again on Irving Street, I shall return.
author: Susan B.

description: A nice quiet place to grab coffee. Cash only.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The mocha was good for $3.15. I liked that it was served warm enough but not scalding hot. Just the right drinking temperature. However, it wasn't "chocolatey" enough (if thats the right word). It would have benefited from more cocoa to it, just to give it more smoothness and a rich texture. 

The cafe's interior was very clean, neat and pleasant. The bistro tables can be a little too small to be comfortable. But overall, a nice place to grab a boost, before heading elsewhere!
author: Pancakes D.

description:
A nice cup of hot coffee from Beanery on a foggy or the rare sunny morning in SF sure hits the spot. 

The place has as much room inside as any other tiny coffee joints. Service is very friendly and quick. I like how the table counter is filled with coffee beans and there are barrels and other coffee bean decor around the place. Just makes it feel like you're in caffeine paradise. 

Definitely love the prices of their coffee. A 12 oz regular brew is only $1.50 and for me, that's a good price for non-starbucks and organic fair trade coffee.

I've had their iced coffee and regular hot coffee. The Italian roast has a nice aroma to it and the mocha java has that hint of chocolate that cocoa coffee drinkers want. My brother got the hot chocolate and just one sip was all I needed. I felt like that sip had enough sugar to power me up to run all the way back home.

I'd love to come here again and just bring a newspaper, a book, or a nice 7x7 magazine to read while sipping on some brew.
author: robin w.

description:
i've been coming here for years and LOVE this place.   they have the best coffee in the inner sunset and the NICEST staff ever.   unlike the zillion other chain coffee stores out there, this coffee has flavour and tastes good.   they also have a GREAT selection of teas, should you not want to go the coffee route.   
ambiance is great, love the old coffee roasting machine and the beans adorning the walls.   and the photo of billie holiday in front of a mic... love, LOve, LOVE!!!   want one for my house.   
what can i say?   i also love, LOve, LOVE this coffee shoppe and the awesome crew that works here.  
thank you beanery, for getting me through so many long days and rough mornings!
author: Briana R-k B.

description:
IMO, Beanery brews a good cup of coffee. I enjoy my coffee black and Beanery's is rich with flavor. Everyone is welcome here - locals, visitors, old and young. They also have a fine array of pastries. 

Seating is cozy. Good for insulating against the typical gray Sunset weather.

If you need a bit more elbow room, they have a couple of tables with chairs in front of the cafe and Golden Gate Park is one block north.
author: Cathy K.

description:
CASH ONLY!  Hubby wanted to support the local coffee shop so we went here.  It's a small shop with some chairs but not a whole lot.

He bought:

latte single $2.60 - it was fine.
mandeline cookie .75 - he liked it, I didn't try it.

Total $3.35  Cash Only.  NO Credit cards.

They also have baked goods from Smart Foods $1.75-$1.95, assorted vegan cookies $1.95, biscotti, chocolate chip cookie $1.5, etc.

They sell loose teas, coffee, bag teas from Numi Tea (Oakland based), espresso.

Other locations: 
602 Irving St, SF
1650 Park St, Alameda
2925 College Ave, Berkeley
author: Ann L.

description: My cappuccino today was excellent just a tad of brown sugar. I enjoyed every sip. My only suggestion is more ventilation it was a little warm. Other than that every ones was super friendly and my drink was delicious :)
author: LJ E.

description:
This place is good. So good I get my morning coffee there before work. The coffee is freshly roasted and they also have a good selection of scones, muffins, croissants, etc.

While I always get my coffee to go, the atmosphere seems pretty nice but it's probably difficult to get a seat as it's always crowded (at least on the weekends)

Did I mention that the coffee is really good?
author: Bumble B.

description:
Oh this place was just alright.. it's cute and all, but the service was just ok. I think she said like three words to me to my 50... i sort of felt rejected, it was almost as sad as a little boy who's ice cream falls off the cone before getting a chance to take his first lick. Sad emoticon.

Will I try it again? Yeah probably.
author: Richard T.

description: Get their soy latte. It's scrumptious. Only downer is the cash only policy..grr!!
author: Bree G.

description: Very friendly. I had a caramel latte. Price was decent. The only  critique that I have us that u wish the latte was hotter . Ask for extra hot. I would definitely go back
author: vanessao o.

description:
Happy servers? Check.

Strong, fresh coffee? Check.

Alternative to french roast? Check.

Selection of tasty pastries? Check.

Indoor and outdoor seating? Check. 

Good hours? Check.

Final score? A+
author: Jesse Lu S.

description:
Awesome coffee and chai, great service...

Best part: when you miss the N-Judah or it doesn't show up when the predictor promised it you can sip on a tasty beverage to forget all about the failing MUNI system.

(FYI: outdoor seating consists of only 2 tables I believe but the Golden Gate Park is only 1 block away so why not go sit there instead?)
author: Anya S.

description:
Mmmmm, caffeine me pah-leeze!  When i sit in here on a beautiful foggy day in the sunset, i get high basking in the aroma of coffee beans.  Weird i know, but the smell of fresh coffee really razzes my berries.

Friendly service and one of the most delicious soy hazelnut lattes you will ever sip on.
author: Juv C.

description: As far as coffee goes, they really can't be beat. It's a little on the expensive end at 11 or 12 bucks a pound, but it's well worth it and I believe they roast it there. I usually bounce around between the house blend (amazing), French, and Italian roast.
author: Gavin M.

description: Yum, better than Peets. I think this could be my favorite establishment for coffee outside of the Mission. Great types of lattes wether soy or dairy based. The only downside is the few amounts of tables and no wireless. Bummer, but great place to hang out and write on a foggy morning!
author: Carolina S.

description: Signed up specifically to write this review. That's saying something. Don't get me wrong, the coffee is delicious, however, it comes with a price. I have sworn to stop frequenting this place many times because of one issue. Why can they NOT figure out how to affix a lid to their cups? I mean I just spent $5--$3.75 for the coffee and the balance in tip--and yet again the lid, which I thought I'd secured after they secured it, came loose again! All down the front of my top and it was HOT! What will it take for this coffee joint to get either lids that fit or purchase cups that fit the lids???????? WTF?
author: Elizabeth Q.

description: Pretty decent mochas and lattes. Service isn't super fast. Hard wooden benches along the side shift when people get up. Tight space, but open patio seating (if the crazies aren't around.) Big display of their roaster, which takes up the majority of the space. Convenient when strolling through Golden Gate Park
author: Naomi K.

description: Mmm...such lovely lattes!  Stopped by on the way back to work and I was most impressed with the drink - very nicely frothed milk and the espresso shot had just enough potency to come through without being overpowering.  Easily one of the best I've had with awesome baristas and a cozy, relaxed atmosphere to boot =D
author: Eric F.

description:
Normally having one cup of coffee from a place would deter me from writing a review of it, but the soy latte I got from the Beanery was so good I felt inclined to tell others about it.
Even though the Beanery was jam packed, they were fast and had good service. 
It appears the have a lot of regulars and that they remember most of their drink orders.
The pastries looked delicious and I wish I had tried one. Only downside is that it is cash only, but what a great place to grab a cup of coffee.
author: Katharine E.

description:
I own a reusable plastic coffee cup emblazoned with the CHP logo and the catchy slogan "Don't Hesitate to Designate!" I got the cup for free, but I am a bit shy about bringing it out in public since the cool kids are always busting out their stainless steel mugs and fancy thermoses printed with Starbucks symbols or the Mona Lisa or whatever.

Being all environmentally friendly though, I decided to bring my cup to the Beanery, intending to fill it with delicious hot coffee. And you know what? The folks behind the counter did not judge. I was all like "Good morning, can I get a small coffee please. (waves cup in the air)" And the guy behind the counter said, "Sure thing. And thanks for reminding me that designated drivers save lives."

The coffee was sublime.
author: Kat A.

description:
It's the coffee machine for the inner sunset. Always fresh made to warm your heart. Thanks for saving us from Starbucks, which is just a corner away. 

I'm very surprised when the owner and the barista greet me when I just passed by. They know my personal preference and make my coffee when I'm still in the line. It is a place where you can truly enjoy the coffee and being around with friendly people.
author: Chiqui H.

description:
I love The Beanery. The employees are all super nice, and put up with me being indecisive every Saturday morning about what size coffee I need. I'm a big fan of their roaster's blend. It's smooth, sweet and not too acidic. I try to support local businesses, so I also buy their beans on occasion. Next time you're in the neighborhood, give them a try.

Minus one star because often the milk is empty and there is crud all over the bar. The layout of the coffee bar is also kind of strange--there isn't really anywhere to hand off drinks except by the cash register, so there's quite a crowd in that tiny 2' x 2' spot.
author: Adriana A.

description:
My high school used to have a little section in the cafeteria called "the beanery" as well. You could buy prepackaged bagels, sandwiches, cartons of milk, cookies, etc.

The food was horrible. It was the beanery or the cafeteria - and the cafeteria was worse than prison food.

The beanery was disgusto. Dirrrty like when Xtina Aguilera did her music video. High school kids went there, pushed each other around - they'd make fun of the special ed kids. Some couples would be making out in the corner and doing godknowswhat.  Some kids genuinely wanted to get some food and would have their money in hand - only to have some gangster wannabe snatch it out of their hands and bolt out of the beanery.  It was chaotic.  It was sad. Yes, I am one of the many deformed and dysfunctional products of a public school system. 

So when I saw the Beanery on Irving this past Saturday, my heart skipped several beats. Memories of the beanery in high school started to flood my mind. I did not want to go in. However, I really needed that coffee and I knew Starbucks was not going to do it. (Note: I am proud to say that  I am no longer drinking Starbucks. I have not walked into a Starbucks since.. last month).

The Beanery on Irving was chill - there were a number of single dudes hangin' out each occupying their own table - preying on any hot girl customers while pretending to read the SF Chronicle, which has gone to nothing now, but still, they were making an effort to look well-read. 

The staff was friendly. I tried to use my Spanish and they laughed and talked to me in English. I ordered a single latte ($2.60) which came out strong. Just the way I like it. I will definitely come back here again. It was nothing like the beanery in high school. There was no making out, no stealing money, none of that. Just good old neighborhood folks and some good coffee.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Good coffee, I'm definitely a fan. I wish they made their own pastries but I guess that's what Arizmendi's is for, right? Customer service was friendly.
author: Amanda R.

description:
I usually go to Starbucks for my coffee, but Beanery Coffee gave me a different outlook. Here, I got a quality, delicious drink and the prices for were very reasonable. I was a first-timer today, and I tried the Caramel Latte. I do plan on coming back for this drink and also to try the others that Beanery Coffee serves.

If you're up for a change in your daily cup of coffee and you want quality, go to Beanery Coffee!
author: Kay Y.

description:
"A double Macchiato with stained milk, please. No foam!" 

When done right, the order is flavorful and packs a wallop of caffeine. Courteous and friendly service.

=)
author: DAVID N.

description:
In my search for a new place to live I met with a woman E. who had a room to let in her apartment. We talked for about two hours and I left feeling like I could definitely share the space with her. Well, she called the next day and told me she had decided to keep the place to herself for now but she really liked me and would like to hang out sometime.
So we made a date to rendezvous at The Beanery for coffee this morning at 10. I got here 20 minutes early and decided to get a house coffee. I began with the Organic French Roast. Exquisite in its rich, full-bodied darkness. I nursed my cup for about 30 minutes, looking up often to see if E. had come in. I then bought the Sumatran blend and was equally impressed but getting jittery now. Had I ben stood up? Was she okay? I had her number and called, leaving a message and she called me back. She was at THE Beanery and I was merely at  
Beanery..two blocks apart. So I gulped the rest of my coffee and trotted down to the other cafe where we finally met up. Interesting about this Beanery, they roast their coffee once a week here and the other roasting is done in their Oakland shop. Prices are good and coffee strong!
author: michael s.

description:
Dropped in, hate a latte to-go.  Didn't hang around too much.

The barista and cashier seemed nice enough.  Nothing exorbitantly awesome in terms of service.  But not many people can impress anyone in less than 20 seconds and in 3-4 sentences unless you're me (or Obama or God).

The latte was good.  Same as usual, nothing exorbitantly awesome that made me say this kicks the sh$t out of every other coffee shop I've  been to!  Better than Starbucks or Peet's?  Sure.  Better than the typical SF stalwarts like Phil'z or Blue Bottle?  Not really.

As far as what I've seen I liked the seating.  Can't fit a lot..but has 2-3 tables outside which is good for people watching on the busy streets of 9th & Irving.
author: Yup S.

description:
Excellent drip coffees, and quite a variety... not only the standard "house blend" which has been sitting around all day.  Organic French roast is very smooth, and there's a few fair-trade blends as well.

Friendly employees, not too pretentious with a nice diverse customer base.  Not sure if they have wifi, I wasn't able to pick it up.
author: Cooper S.

description: A locally known place to grab coffee when in a rush. I always buy organic coffee by the pound to brew at home, but I go in for a cup of joe when I'm in a rush or when meeting some friends.
author: Aaron H.

description: Great cup of coffee, the light roast decaf has all the robust flavor of a dark roast with no bitter after taste, so if your near by one, skip the Starbucks and go here instead.
author: Emmanuel C.

description: this is a great place to grab a cup of coffee. The owner appears to roast all of the beans himself, which makes it a great alternative to the Starbucks down the street.
author: Brian M.

description:
